Procurement Contract 
Supplier: Alpha Suppliers Inc. 
Buyer: PLASMA Corporation 
Contract Number: PC-001 
Effective Date: January 1, 2023 
Expiry Date: March 31, 2023 
1. Introduction 
This Procurement Contract (the "Contract") is entered into between 
PLASMA 
Corporation (hereinafter referred to as the "Buyer") and Alpha 
Suppliers Inc. (hereinafter referred to as the "Supplier"). The 
purpose of this Contract is to outline the terms and conditions for 
the procurement of goods and/or services as specified herein. 
2. Scope of Work 
The Buyer engages the Supplier to provide the following goods and/or 
services (hereinafter referred to as the "Deliverables"): 
- Office stationery and supplies, including pens, paper, folders, and 
other stationery items, as specified in the attached Purchase Order. 
- Any additional stationery items requested by the Buyer during the 
contract period. 
3. Purchase Order 
The Buyer shall issue a Purchase Order (PO) to the Supplier for each 
procurement of goods and/or services. The PO shall include, but not be 
limited to, the following information: 
- PO Number: PO-00123 
- Description of the Deliverables: Office stationery and supplies as 
specified in the attached Purchase Order. 
- Quantity: As per the Buyer's requirements. 
- Price per unit: To be agreed upon between the Buyer and Supplier. 
- Delivery schedule: As per the Buyer's request. 
- Payment terms: Net 30 days from the date of receipt and acceptance 
of the Deliverables. 
- Any other relevant terms and conditions as specified in the attached 
Purchase Order. 
4. Delivery and Acceptance 
The Supplier shall ensure timely delivery of the Deliverables as per 
the agreed-upon schedule outlined in the respective Purchase Order(s). 
The Buyer shall inspect and evaluate the Deliverables upon receipt. 
Acceptance of the Deliverables shall be subject to compliance with the 
specified quality standards, specifications, and any other 
requirements stated in the Contract. 
5. Payment Terms 
The Buyer agrees to pay the Supplier as per the agreed-upon payment 
terms specified in the Purchase Order(s). Payment shall be made within 
30 days of receipt and acceptance of the Deliverables. Invoices should 
be submitted by the Supplier in accordance with the guidelines 
provided by the Buyer. 
6. Quality Assurance 
The Supplier warrants that all Deliverables provided under this 
Contract shall conform to the specified quality standards, free from 
defects in materials and workmanship. In the event of any 
nonconformities 

page - [1]
or defects, the Supplier shall promptly rectify the issue 
or replace the Deliverables at no additional cost to the Buyer. 
7. Intellectual Property Rights 
Any intellectual property rights associated with the Deliverables 
shall remain the property of the Supplier unless otherwise agreed upon 
in writing. The Buyer shall have a non-exclusive, royalty-free license 
to use the Deliverables solely for the purpose specified in this 
Contract. 
8. Confidentiality 
Both parties agree to maintain the confidentiality of any proprietary 
or sensitive information disclosed during the course of this Contract. 
This includes, but is not limited to, trade secrets, financial 
information, technical data, and any other confidential information 
identified as such. 
9. Termination 
Either party may terminate this Contract in the event of a material 
breach by the other party. Termination shall be effective upon written 
notice to the breaching party. In the event of termination, the 
parties shall fulfill any outstanding obligations and settle any 
outstanding payments. 
10. Governing Law and Dispute Resolution 
This Contract shall be governed by and construed in accordance with 
the laws of [Jurisdiction]. Any disputes arising out of or in 
connection with this Contract shall be resolved through amicable 
negotiations between the parties. If a resolution cannot be reached, 
the parties agree to submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the 
courts of [Jurisdiction]. 
Environmental Sustainability (“ES”) Criteria 
1. ES Strategy 
(a) Carbon neutrality: Plasma Corporation is committed to becoming carbon neutral across its 
value chain by 
2030 with the following stipulation: All Plasma Corporation products and/or services should be 
carbon 
neutral by 2030. Additionally, Plasma Corporation has committed to become a net zero carbon 
emissions 
company across the value chain by 2040. 
(b) Water quality: Plasma Corporation is committed to becoming water sustainable in its 
operations and to 
ensuring that manufacturing effluents have no water quality impacts on the receiving aquatic 
environment. 
(c) Waste reduction: Plasma Corporation is committed to becoming plastic neutral by 2030 by 
promot-ing 
circular economy, continuously reducing waste in operations, and adopting eco-friendly materials 
in its products and/or services where feasible. 
2. ES Expectations 
(a) Carbon: Supplier shall ensure that all products and/or services procured by Plasma 
Corporation should be 
carbon neutral by 2030. 
(b) Water: Supplier shall ensure water is used responsibly throughout their operations and avoid 
any water quality impacts on the receiving aquatic environment as per local regu-latory 
requirements. 

page - [2]
(c) Waste: Supplier shall aim to continuously reduce waste in its operations and adopt eco-friendly 
materials for products and/or services procured by Plasma Corporation where feasible. 
(d) Supplier along with their approved subcontractors/suppliers shall support Plasma Corporation’ 
ES 
Strategy by complying with (i) the provisions of Sections 2 (a) to (c) above, (ii) any appli-cable 
laws relating to ES and (iii) any terms in the existing contract relating to ES. 
3. ES Related Data Collection & Reporting Obligations 
(a) Upon request, Supplier shall grant access to Plasma Corporation, its Affiliates and/or 
designated representatives 
for conducting assessments on Supplier’s performance with regard to the ES 
Expectations for products and/or services procured by Plasma Corporation. 
(b) Together with Plasma Corporation, Supplier and its Affiliates shall establish a sustainability 
roadmap for 
products and/or services procured by Plasma Corporation, including agreeing to track certain ES 
related Key 
Performance Indicators (“ES KPIs”), defining baselines and setting milestones in order to track 
Supplier’s performance with regard to the ES Expectations and to iden-tify opportunities to 
improve Supplier’s and its Affiliates ES performance. 
(c) Supplier and its Affiliates shall establish and maintain ES data in accordance with the relevant 
sustainability standards e.g. Global Reporting Initiative (“GRI”) and the respec-tive materiality 
assessment. Supplier will also ensure same standards are followed by their suppliers and overall 
supply chain. 
Environmental Sustainability Criteria 
(d) Supplier and its Affiliates shall establish and maintain Plasma Corporation product/service 
specific ES 
data (Product/ Service Carbon Footprint), and shall make it available to Plasma Corporation on 
annual basis. 
For this, they shall follow industry framework e.g. Partnership for Carbon Transparency (PACT) 
framework developed by the World Business Council for Sustain-able Development (WBCSD). 
(e) Supplier and its Affiliates shall allow Plasma Corporation to report their ES related data 
regarding 
products and/or services procured by Plasma Corporation and/or its Affiliates to an independent 
third-party 
platform in an anonymized form, as may be required for the purposes of ex-ternal reporting, 
benchmarking and auditing. 
4. Sustainability Standards and Commitments for the Supply Chain 
(a) Supplier and its Affiliates shall establish and maintain public commitments related to car-bon 
emissions and shall align its targets with and have them approved by the Science based targets 
initiative (SBTi) (www.sciencebasedtargets.org). 
(b) Supplier and its Affiliates shall establish and maintain external ES reporting and disclo-sures 
either through CDP (www.cdp.net), covering the climate change and water security modules, or 
through EcoVadis (www.ecovadis.com) in combination with PSCI (www.pscinitiative.org). 
(c) Supplier and its Affiliates shall provide, upon request from Plasma Corporation or at an agreed 
frequency, 
the relevant environmental footprint data accredited by an independent third party (e.g., 
SGS, TUEV, Bureau Veritas, etc.). 
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
- 
Acknowledgment 
We refer to all existing agreement(s) between Plasma Corporation and 

page - [3]
................................................................. (Supplier legal entity name) that are in effect 
(“Agreement”). 
With the signing of this document, we intend to amend the Agreement in order to fully 
incorporate the above Environmental Sustainability Criteria. 
................................................................. (Supplier legal entity name) at 
........................................................................................... (Supplier address), acknowledges the 
re-ceipt of the Plasma Corporation’ Environmental Sustainability Criteria and agrees to be bound 
by them. 
This document shall be deemed part of the Agreement and any future reference to the Agreement 
shall include the Environmental Sustainability Criteria. 
 
 
[Signatures] 
________________________ 
John Doe 
Procurement Manager 
PLASMA Corporation 
[Date] 
________________________ 
Jane Smith 
Sales Manager 
Alpha Suppliers Inc. 
[Date]
